revised_title: Influence of Oxygen Pressure on Potato Respiration and Metabolism
tldr: The author's study investigates the effect of oxygen at high pressures on the respiration and carbohydrate metabolism of potato tissues. The results show that the rate of CO2 output increases and then decreases when potatoes are exposed to oxygen at pressures of 2 or 3 atm at 15°C. The author suggests that this increase in CO2 output is due to a pathway other than the tricarboxylic acid cycle and may be related to a shortage of sugar phosphate substrates caused by oxygen inhibition of cytochrome-c reductase.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
